content.rendered:
Drug Detox in Hertfordshire

Looking for safe, private drug detox in Hertfordshire? At Abbington House in Stevenage, we offer fast-access detox for people who are ready to stop using substances but are afraid of what withdrawal might feel like. You don’t need to go through it alone. Whether it’s cocaine, heroin, cannabis, ketamine or prescription medications, we offer medical support, comfort and calm – without judgment.

CALL 01438 583222
Home/No breadcrumbs

Our drug detox programme is designed to help your body stabilise safely while giving your mind space to begin healing. We’re not just a clinic. We’re a small, trauma-informed centre that prioritises dignity, trust and emotional safety from the very first day.

What Is Drug Detox?

What Is Drug Detox?

Drug detox is the process of clearing harmful substances from your system while managing the physical and psychological effects of withdrawal. For people who have been using drugs regularly or over a long period, detox can be physically intense and emotionally overwhelming. Detox is more than just stopping. It’s about doing so in a way that’s safe, supported, and aligned with your health needs. At Abbington House, detox always includes:
  • 24/7 medical supervision from trained professionals.
  • A private bedroom in a warm, residential setting
  • Tailored medications to ease withdrawal symptoms
  • Emotional support from day one, including trauma-aware staff
  • Preparation for long-term recovery, not just short-term relief
At Abbington House, we will help you take your first real step toward change.

The Drugs We Help With

We support detox from a wide range of substances, including:

  • Cocaine - Cocaine withdrawal is often marked by psychological distress, crashing mood, anxiety, cravings, and sleep problems. We help you manage these symptoms and stabilise your emotions with full support.
  • Heroin & Opiates - Coming off opiates like heroin or prescription painkillers (codeine, morphine, oxycodone) requires a medically managed detox plan. We provide safe opioid withdrawal protocols, with round-the-clock monitoring.
  • Cannabis - While often underestimated, cannabis withdrawal can cause irritability, insomnia, appetite changes, and anxiety. Our team provides non-judgmental care in a peaceful, structured environment.
  • Ketamine - We support individuals coming off ketamine, particularly those struggling with bladder issues, dissociation, or mental fog. A combination of medical care and therapy is often helpful here.
  • Prescription Medications - This includes benzodiazepines (like diazepam or Xanax), sleeping pills, antidepressants, and stimulant medications. These require slow, supervised tapering for safety.
  • Polydrug Use - Many people use combinations of drugs (e.g. cocaine + alcohol, opioids + benzos). We develop a tailored detox plan that prioritises your safety, comfort, and long-term stability.
If you’re unsure whether you need detox, we can help you assess your situation in confidence. No obligation. No judgment.

Why Abbington House?

We’re not a big, impersonal facility. Abbington House is a small, private, trauma-informed rehab based in a quiet residential area of Stevenage, Hertfordshire. Everything we do is designed to help people feel safe, seen, and supported - especially during the most vulnerable first days of recovery. Here’s what sets us apart:

  • Small-Scale Setting: You’ll never feel lost in the crowd. Our capacity is limited, by design.
  • Private Bedrooms: Your detox process happens in your own space, not a hospital ward.
  • Trauma-Informed Care: Our team understands how addiction often connects with past trauma. We won’t retraumatise you.
  • Non-Judgmental Approach: We don’t care how many times you’ve relapsed. We care that you’re here now.
  • Full Continuum of Support: We help you move from detox into therapy, relapse prevention, and long-term recovery—without gaps in care..
Drug detox isn’t easy. But it doesn’t have to be traumatic. At Abbington House, it’s done with care, professionalism, and human connection at every step.

Getting to Abbington House from Your Area


Abbington House is located in Stevenage, making it easy to access from across Hertfordshire and surrounding counties. We regularly support clients from:

  • St Albans – 25 mins by car
  • Hatfield – 20 mins by car
  • Hitchin – 15 mins by car
  • Welwyn Garden City – 15 mins by car
  • Letchworth – 10 mins by car
  • Hemel Hempstead – 30 mins by car
  • Hertford – 20 mins by car>Hemel Hempstead

We’re just a few minutes from the A1(M) and Stevenage train station. Once you’re admitted, we’ll provide full directions, local travel options, and arrival instructions.

Being close to home makes it easier to take that first step. Being far enough to focus without distraction gives you the space to heal.

What Happens After Detox?

Drug detox is a critical first step, but it’s not treatment on its own. True recovery begins after your body has stabilised. That’s why we don’t just discharge people the moment withdrawal symptoms fade. We help you prepare for the next phase with clarity, confidence, and real support. At Abbington House, most people continue directly into our residential rehab programme, which includes:

  • One-to-one therapy – Trauma-informed sessions using CBT, EMDR, or person-centred counselling
  • Group support – A small, trusted group of peers sharing lived experience and encouragement
  • Holistic therapies – Mindfulness, movement, journaling, art, music, and sound therapy.
  • Relapse prevention – Tools to identify triggers, build boundaries, and develop a long-term plan

Even if you only come to us for detox, we’ll make sure you leave with a clear aftercare pathway. You won’t be left to figure it out on your own.

FAQs

How quickly can I access drug detox in Hertfordshire?

In many cases, you can begin detox within 24 to 72 hours of your first call. We’ll complete an initial assessment and help you plan next steps quickly and privately.

Do you treat heroin, cocaine, and prescription drug dependence?
Yes. We are fully licensed to support detox from a wide range of substances, including Class A drugs, prescription medications, and polydrug combinations.
What’s the difference between drug detox and rehab?
Detox is the physical process of withdrawal. Rehab is the psychological and emotional treatment that follows. We offer both under one roof, so you don’t have to transfer or start over somewhere new.
Do I need a GP referral to start detox?
No. You can contact us directly. We’re happy to answer your questions or speak with a loved one on your behalf.
Is drug detox painful or dangerous?
With proper medical care, detox can be safe, manageable, and far more comfortable than most people expect. We use medications and therapies to reduce symptoms and help you feel as calm as possible.

Start Your Drug Detox at Abbington House

If you’ve been afraid of what detox might feel like - or if you’ve already tried to quit on your own and found it unbearable - we understand. We approach detox with care, compassion, and structure. Not punishment or shame. Call our admission team now to start your recovery journey.
Call 01438 583222

Explore Drug Detox

  • Drug Rehab
  • Alcohol Detox
  • Medical Detox
